definition[0]: used to say that you are fairly sure that something is true, something is happening etc, although you cannot prove this
example[0]: Bet you wish you’d arrived earlier.
example[1]: I bet you she won’t come.
definition[1]: used to show that you understand or can imagine the situation that someone has just told you about
example[2]: ‘God, I was so angry.’ ‘I bet you were.’
example[3]: ‘It makes things much easier.’ ‘Yeah, I’ll bet it does.’
definition[2]: used to show that you do not believe what someone has just told you
example[4]: ‘I’m definitely going to give up smoking this time.’ ‘Yeah, I bet!’
